resource_dependency.gameBoardSchema: Set up a database with fields: game_id (UUID), grid_state (array of integers representing 4x4 grid), score (integer), best_score (integer), game_status (enum: 'active', 'won', 'over'), created_at (timestamp), updated_at (timestamp).
resource_dependency.tileMoveAPI: POST /api/move - Accepts direction ('up','down','left','right') and returns updated grid_state, score, and game_status.
resource_dependency.newGameAPI: POST /api/new-game - Initializes a new game session and returns initial grid_state and score.
resource_dependency.reviveGameAPI: POST /api/revive - Revives the current game state after game over and returns updated grid_state.
resource_dependency.keyboardNavigationHandler: JavaScript event listener for ArrowUp, ArrowDown, ArrowLeft, ArrowRight key presses mapped to corresponding move actions.

function: Implement a 2048 game board with a 4x4 grid layout
static_description: A 4x4 grid displayed on a linen-colored background with maroon borders around each cell. Empty cells appear as blank squares with light maroon shading.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking anywhere on the grid does not trigger any action unless itâ€™s part of a larger container element such as a restart button.

resource_dependency.moveDirectionAPI: POST /api/move - Requires direction parameter ('up', 'down', 'left', 'right'). Returns updated grid_state, score, and game_status.
resource_dependency.keyboardEventMapper: Arrow key events mapped to directional moves via JavaScript listeners.

function: Support tile movement in four directions: up, down, left, and right
static_description: The game board displays a 4x4 grid where tiles are arranged according to their numerical values. No visible controls except the grid itself.

interaction_and_states.description: Pressing an arrow key sends a request to the backend API with the respective direction. The grid updates based on the returned state.

resource_dependency.mergeLogicAPI: Backend logic within POST /api/move handles merging of identical adjacent tiles and updates the grid accordingly before returning results.
resource_dependency.scoreUpdateAPI: Score increment handled server-side during tile merges and included in response payload from /api/move.

function: Enable merging of identical adjacent tiles during movement
static_description: Identical numbered tiles positioned next to each other along the movement path will visually merge into one tile with the sum of their values.

interaction_and_states.description: Tiles slide and merge automatically when moved. Merged tiles update their value display and increase the total score dynamically.

resource_dependency.scoreTrackingField: Database field 'score' tracks current game points; also includes 'best_score' for persistent tracking across sessions.
resource_dependency.updateScoreEndpoint: Score updated server-side with every successful move and sent back in API responses.

function: Track and display the current game score
static_description: Score panel located above the game grid showing two sections: 'Score' and 'Best'. Both show integer values styled in maroon text against the linen background.

interaction_and_states.description: Each time a merge occurs, the score increases by the merged tile's value. The score panel updates immediately after receiving the new score from the backend.

resource_dependency.gameOverDetectionAPI: Server checks for possible moves after each turn. If none exist, sets game_status to 'over' and returns this status in API response.
resource_dependency.gameOverModalContent: Modal overlay displaying 'Game Over!' message with options to revive or start new game.

function: Detect and handle game over state when no moves are available
static_description: Entire screen dims slightly with a centered modal appearing that reads 'Game Over!' in large maroon font, offering buttons labeled 'Revive' and 'New Game'.

interaction_and_states.description: After a move, if no further moves are possible, the game transitions to a 'Game Over' state, triggering a modal popup.

resource_dependency.startNewGameAPI: POST /api/new-game initializes fresh grid_state and resets score to zero.

function: Allow users to start a new game at any time
static_description: A circular maroon button with a white '+' icon placed near the top-right corner of the game area. Text label beneath says 'New Game'.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the button triggers a call to the /api/new-game endpoint which resets the game board and score, then refreshes the UI with new initial state.

resource_dependency.winConditionCheckAPI: Server evaluates grid_state after each move to check if any tile equals 2048. If true, sets game_status to 'won'.
resource_dependency.winCelebrationPopup: Popup modal saying 'You Win!' with option to keep playing or start a new game.

function: Implement win condition detection when a tile reaches 2048
static_description: Upon reaching 2048, a celebratory modal appears featuring bold maroon text stating 'You Win!', accompanied by confetti animation effects.

interaction_and_states.description: Once a tile hits 2048, the game pauses and shows a win modal while still allowing continued play without resetting.

resource_dependency.reviveGameAPI: POST /api/revive resumes gameplay from the last known grid_state after game over, keeping existing score intact.
resource_dependency.reviveOptionButton: Button inside Game Over modal labeled 'Revive'.

function: Provide a revive option after game over to continue playing
static_description: Within the Game Over modal, alongside the New Game button, there is another button labeled 'Revive', styled identically in maroon.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Revive' dismisses the modal and reactivates the game board, restoring previous state but preventing additional scoring until a new tile spawns.

function: Design the game interface with a linen background color
static_description: Entire page background rendered in soft linen tone (#FAF0E6) covering full viewport behind the main game interface.

resource_dependency.primaryColorPalette: .maroon-style { color: maroon; border-color: maroon; } applied globally to all interactive and structural elements.

function: Style all game components using maroon as the primary color
static_description: All buttons, grid lines, score numbers, and modal headers use maroon (#800000) as the dominant accent color throughout the interface.

resource_dependency.cssTransitionRules: CSS transitions applied to tile movements and merges for fluid animation experience.

function: Ensure smooth tile animations during movement and merging
static_description: Tiles glide smoothly between positions with subtle fade-in effects upon creation and scaling animations during merges.

interaction_and_states.description: Tiles animate from original position to final destination using CSS transform and transition properties over ~150ms duration.

resource_dependency.fontStylingResource: Use clear sans-serif fonts like Arial or Helvetica for legibility of numeric tile values.

function: Display numeric values clearly on each tile
static_description: Each tile contains a bold, centered number matching its value, sized appropriately to fill most of the tile space with high contrast against tile background.

resource_dependency.sessionStorageMechanism: Client-side sessionStorage used temporarily to preserve ongoing game progress between browser reloads or tabs.
resource_dependency.persistGameStateAPI: Optional enhancement where POST /api/save-state stores current game snapshot in database under user session.

function: Maintain game state persistence during gameplay
static_description: Game continues seamlessly even if user navigates away briefly or refreshes the page due to local storage caching of active session.

interaction_and_states.description: On reload, system attempts to restore latest saved game state either from localStorage or backend if authenticated.

resource_dependency.responsiveGridMediaQueries: @media queries adjust grid size, font sizing, and control spacing for mobile, tablet, desktop breakpoints.

function: Include responsive design for different screen sizes
static_description: Layout adapts gracefully from compact mobile viewports to wide desktop screens, maintaining readability and usability across devices.

resource_dependency.keyboardEventListener: Global window.addEventListener('keydown') captures arrow key inputs and maps them to directional movement functions.

function: Add keyboard support for arrow key navigation
static_description: Users can navigate the game solely through keyboard without needing mouse interaction thanks to registered arrow key handlers.

interaction_and_states.description: ArrowUp, ArrowDown, ArrowLeft, ArrowRight keys initiate tile movement calls equivalent to swipe gestures on touchscreens.
